Assessment.QuestionText: Which of the following statements about custom controls are true and which statements are false?

Options.Option: Custom controls are added by right-clicking the toolbox and clicking the .NET Framework Components option.
Windows Forms existing controls cannot be inherited in your application.
The <font face="courier new">ToolboxBitmapAttribute</font> class is used to specify a particular image for the custom control.
Toolbox bitmap is specified by adding <font face="courier new">ToolboxBitmapAttribute</font> below the class declaration of the custom control.
Custom controls are programmatically used in your application by using the namespace in which the control is created.

Assessment.CorrectFeedback: Yes, that's correct! You get one point for your response.
Assessment.incorrectFeedback: No, that's incorrect. The correct selections are: (A)-(False), (B)-(False), (C)-(True), (D)-(False), and (E)-(True).
